title: The Moonlight Lodge
short: Meta funded VR Multiplayer project about natural interactions with LLM agents.

sections.title: Project
sections.content: This unannounced VR multiplayer game has been my biggest project yet, developed alongside industry veterans while I took on significant responsibilities. Players solve a murder mystery by interacting with synchronized AI agents, powered by layered LLMs for stability, viseme-driven emotions, and generated voices.

sections.title: Responsibilities
sections.content: I handled all front-end Unity work, focusing on multiplayer and VR setup. I implemented gameplay features, maintained the Unity project, and optimized performance for Meta Quest 3 standalone. My involvement in AI interactions and backend behavior trees was partial.

sections.title: Client
sections.content: Operative Games, co-founded by Jon Snoddy (former Disney Imagineering R&D leader), is a Los Angeles-based studio pioneering AI-driven interactive storytelling. I was mentored by Ryan Green, a BAFTA- and Game Award-winning developer and creative director at Numinous Games, and collaborated with renowned audio engineers, storytellers, and project managers. I also met part of the team in Toronto, Canada.

title: Year of the Cicadas
short: A VR project funded by Unity about exploring grief for losing a child.

sections.title: Project
sections.content: Year of the Cicadas is an immersive VR experience that guides the player through Kim Hieftje's grieving process after the loss of her son Cody. The cicadas play a significant role in the project, as they only surface every dozen years and happened to be swarming Cody's tombstone right after he passed away.

sections.title: Responsibilities
sections.content: I wasn't involved during the entire development of the game, but more toward the end. During my time on the project, I mainly managed interns who were contributing to the development, helping them connect the dots. I also stayed with Kim and her husband Bernard for a couple of weeks in Connecticut America, during which we had the chance to talk about her grief and relate it to my own.

sections.title: Client
sections.content: Kimberly (Kim) Hieftje, PhD is an Associate Professor of Pediatrics at Yale School of Medicine and co-director (and co-founder) of XR Pediatrics and the Yale Center for Immersive Technologies in Pediatrics. She leads research on immersive reality and serious games to promote health, behavior change, and education among youth.

title: Activision Blizzard Media Playable Ads
short: Built a modular pipeline for dozens of bite-size playable ads.

sections.title: Project Overview
sections.content: I developed 40+ polished playable ads for Activision Blizzard Media's mobile game library, each served over 3 million times on average. I also helped build a modular platform that enabled rapid ad development and component reuse across campaigns.

sections.title: Responsibilities
sections.content: I handled the full process of coding, integrating ABM artwork, and polishing the ads. This helped raise the overall quality and complexity of ABM's ad library. I also conducted R&D on integrating ads into the Xbox interface following Microsoft's acquisition of Activision.

sections.title: Client
sections.content: At Activision Blizzard Media, I worked closely with Senior Creative Director Brian Janelli on campaigns for clients including McDonald’s, Walmart, Pepsi, Ben & Jerry’s, KitKat, the UK Government, Honda, and more.

title: The Fizzler
short: A game about spraying champagne made on my own during GGJA 2025 while hosting the site.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: I built this game for Global Game Jam Antwerp 2025 while also hosting the site, so most of the work happened after 10 PM. Being the first to rise and one of the last to sleep, I'm proud to have created my own tiny game during the event. The game itself is a playful gimmick where your friend urges you to keep buying champagne to impress a girl at the club.

title: Up With the Sub
short: A local co-op submarine adventure for a class project, voted as “Best Game of the Course 2020.” by our teachers.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
This project was created during the Game Projects course at DAE, a program where all majors come together to collaborate on a game. Together with two artists and another programmer, we successfully completed what became my first Unity project.

While learning the basics of Unity, I focused on implementing controllable characters, a simple crafting system, and the physics for both the items and the submarine.

Our project was highly praised by both students and teachers, earning the Teachers' Prize for Greatest Game of the Course of the Year. In 2025, I heard from my interns that it's still being showcased as an example during the course's introduction.

title: GGJ Theme Committee + Site Organizer
short: Co-organizing the Global Game Jam Antwerp site and contributing in the GGJ theme committee.

sections.title: GGJ Theme Committee
sections.content: Starting from GGJ 2026, I'll be part of the GGJ Theme Committee. In addition, I'll be designing a trophy and certificate that other site organizers can (3D) print for their participants.

sections.title: GGJA 2025 & 2026
sections.content:
In 2025, I co-organized the Antwerp GGJ site. Thanks to our sponsors, we managed to host a free two-night on-site game jam (food/drinks/snacks included) with 65 participants.

During my spare time, I also developed my own game, The Fizzler. In 2026, I'm planning to do this all over again!

title: 3D Printing
short: Designing, printing, and painting custom parts, props, trophees, and miniatures as a hobby.

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
Ever since I bought my Bambu Lab A1 printer, I haven't stopped 3D printing. I'm usually skeptical about whether a new hobby will stick, but this time I quickly knew it would.

I've also had the opportunity to use 3D printing professionally, designing and printing trophies for several game jams with up to 60 participants. More recently, I've become more involved with the GGJ, which gave me the opportunity to design a trophy for all site organizers to use and print.
